intro: Ononis leucotricha f. perez-larae, commonly known as the white-haired bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, oval legumes as fruits, which contain several seeds. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This subspecies is notable for its adapted morphology, enabling it to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
